entries.title: Avalanches in Alps Kill at Least 11, as Weather Hampers Rescues
entries.description: Deaths were reported in Austria, Italy and Switzerland over the weekend. Heavy snowfall and high winds have increased the danger for skiers, officials said.

entries.title: Russia’s Foreign Minister Lavrov Heads to Mali
entries.description: Mali said it and Russia will seek to strengthen security and defense ties, in a country where Russia already provides helicopters and mercenaries.

entries.title: China’s Balloon Dispute Aims Attention at Xi’s Leadership
entries.description: The flap with the United States raises concerns about how China wields its power in a climate where one wrong move could set off an accidental conflict.

entries.title: Live Updates: Earthquake Kills More Than 1,300 in Turkey and Syria
entries.description: The 7.8 magnitude quake was felt in four countries. Thousands more were wounded, and the death toll appeared likely to keep rising.

entries.title: Turkey Earthquake: Governments Are Sending Rescue Teams and Offers of Aid
entries.description: European Union countries dispatched search and rescue teams, and the United States said it was “ready to provide any and all needed assistance” to Turkey.

entries.title: Russian Attacks Intensify in East, Ukraine Says
entries.description: The scope of Moscow’s assault appears to be widening as Ukraine warns of a new Russian offensive.

entries.title: Seven Surprises
entries.description: After a four-month book leave, I’m looking at what changed during that time.

entries.title: How News of the Earthquake Spread in Gaziantep, the Epicenter
entries.description: People in the city in southern Turkey fled from their homes into the cold after the 7.8 magnitude earthquake.

entries.title: Reveling in the Eerie and the Spooky, but Finding ‘True Horror’ in Real Life
entries.description: The author Mariana Enriquez deploys — and enjoys — horror conventions. But in “Our Share of Night,” she reminds readers that the violence we live with can be far more frightening.

entries.title: Musharraf’s Legacy: A Conflicted Pakistan and a Bristling Military
entries.description: The former Pakistani general and ruler, a central player in post-9/11 global tensions, ultimately lost his hold on the Pakistani public, and even on his own military establishment.

entries.title: After the Quake: Photos from Turkey and Syria
entries.description: The deadly earthquake was felt in at least four countries, with most of the casualties and the heaviest damage reported in Turkey and Syria.

entries.title: The earthquake struck war-scarred northern Syria.
entries.description: After more than a decade of conflict, northern Syria will be ill-equipped to recover from Monday’s earthquake amid a collapsing economy.

entries.title: Four Takeaways From Corruption Trial of Genaro Garcia Luna, Former Mexican Lawman
entries.description: Jurors at the trial of Genaro García Luna have heard about murders, kidnappings, drug shipments and accusations of bribes paid by the Sinaloa drug cartel.

entries.title: Israeli Raid Kills at Least 5 Palestinians in West Bank
entries.description: The Israeli Army said the deaths near Jericho came during an operation to arrest gunmen accused of attempting an attack. This year has been the deadliest start for Palestinians in the West Bank in a decade and a half.

entries.title: In Hong Kong, 47 Democracy Leaders on Trial for Security Charges
entries.description: Forty-seven defendants, including well-known figures like Joshua Wong, are charged with subversion under the national security law that China imposed in 2020.

entries.title: How strong is a magnitude-7.8 quake?
entries.description: Experts fear that the quake in Turkey on Monday was strong and shallow enough to be lethal on a devastating scale.

entries.title: Your Monday Briefing
entries.description: The aftereffects from a Chinese spy balloon.

entries.title: A Timeline of Deadly Earthquakes in Turkey
entries.description: Turkey, a hotbed of seismic activity, sits on the Anatolian Plate, which borders two major faults as it grinds northeast against Eurasia.

entries.title: ‘Baraye,’ the Anthem of Iran’s Protest Movement, Is Honored With a Grammy
entries.description: Shervin Hajipour won in a new special merit category recognizing a song for social change. The song has become the anthem of protests that have swept through Iran in recent months.

entries.title: Teenage Girl Dies After Shark Attack in Australian River
entries.description: The girl, 16, may have jumped into the water to swim with a pod of dolphins when she was attacked, the authorities said.

entries.title: U.S. Navy Divers Work to Recover Debris From Chinese Spy Balloon as Diplomacy Dwindles
entries.description: The effort off the coast of South Carolina is expected to take days, and Navy and Coast Guard ships have been sent to the scene. U.S. officials are watching for retaliation from China.

entries.title: Chinese Spy Balloon Calls Back to Cold War U-2 Episode
entries.description: The Chinese balloon saga is reminiscent of the U-2 spy plane incident that provoked a tense confrontation between the United States and the Soviet Union.

entries.title: Balloon Incident Reveals More Than Spying as Competition With China Intensifies
entries.description: There is nothing new about superpowers spying on one another, even from balloons. But for pure gall, there was something different this time.
